description: Demolition of five existing residential buildings and redevelopment of part 3, part 4 and part 5 storey building comprising of a total of 54 flats (one, two and three bed units) for affordable housing, landscaping, parking and refuse storage
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings (4.1, B1, B5 and ES6). | No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscaping works to include retention of Pine T3 as shown in Arboricultural Method Statement by Simon Jones Assoc dated January 2004, and including detail on replacement plantings as well as landscaping for garden and communal areas and trees and shrub planting specifically to the gardens backing onto the railway and those fronting Gunnersbury Lane and including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  These works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme, shall be replaced during the next planting season.  (The replacement of TPO trees shall include species, Fagus Sylvatica Dawyk and Fagus Sylvatica and the size at planting of these replacement trees will be required to be 50-60cm girth specimen).  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and pedestrian/vehicular safety (4.5, 9.1, B2, B16, ES4 and T62 and T63). | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected.  The boundary treatment shall be completed before the buildings are used.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and thereafter permanently retained.   REASON: To protect the amenity of the area (4.1, B1, B5, B8, ES5 and ES6). | Dustbin and enclosed refuse areas, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, shall be sited a maximum distance of 23 metres (10 metres where paladins are employed) from an adopted highway, and a maximum 25 metres from any dwelling unit intended to use them.  The refuse areas shall be implemented as approved prior to first occupation and permanently retained.  REASON: To comply with the Council's Design Guides (4.1, B1 and H34). | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards or the equivalent RSL standard, unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works.  The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation.  REASON: To ensure access for all for future occupiers (5.3, H12 and H13). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the appearance of the area (4.1, 4.5, B1 and B5). | The proposed upper storey windows to the south elevation of the residential development approved shall contain only obscure glass or result in obscurity.  A sample of the glass, no smaller than 300mm square shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development, and the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the sample thus approved.  The details so approved shall be retained permanently.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties (4.1, 5.5, B1 and B5). | Details of a method statement for measures to ensure full tree protection to BS 5837 shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works on site.  The approved measures shall be implemented prior to construction and retained until the end of the construction period.  REASON:  To prevent damage to the trees and in the interest of the visual character and appearance of the area. (4.5 and B16). | Residential accommodation shall be constructed to include at least 10% of the units as wheelchair accessible, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works.  The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation.  REASON: To ensure that an adequate proportion of units is wheelchair accessible (5.3, H12 and H13). | The development hereby authorised shall comply with 'The aims and objectives of the Police requirements of Secure By Design.'  REASON: to ensure that the proposed development achieves the required crime prevention elements as detailed by Government Circular 5/94 'Planning Out Crime', and with the requirements of Clause 17 of the Crime and Disorder Act 1998 which imposes a duty on a Local Authority 'to do all that it can to prevent crime and disorder in its area' (4.3, 4.4, B20 and Supplementary Guidance "Safer Ealing"). | Notwithstanding the information contained in the submitted plans, details of pedestrian and vehicular visibility splays consisting of 1.5m x 1.5m x 0.6m (h) shall be provided at the main entrance from Gunnersbury Lane leading into the residential development or by other means to address visibility shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development. The footways across the proposed vehicle access shall be continuous and a crossover with dropped kerbs shall be provided where the footway meets the carriageway.  Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any of the units and thereafter permanently retained.   REASON:  In the interest of pedestrian/highway safety (4.3, 9.1, B6, ES3, T62 and T63). | Not withstanding the submitted plan details showing 5 disabled parking spaces shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced. The details of the parking layout so agreed shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development and the spaces kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose.  Reason:  To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site (9.1, 9.11 and T63). | Details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, to demonstrate that a composite sound reduction index of not less than 34 dB for bedrooms and not less than 29dB for living rooms will be achieved for the building envelope, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided.  The details shall also include the provision of alternative means of ventilation in each room in accordance with Authority's criteria.  The works shall be completed before occupation and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the development (4.1, B1). | No gate/barrier into the proposed car park area shall be installed without prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.    REASON: In the interest of pedestrian/highway safety (9.1). | No development shall take place until the applicant has secured the implementation of a programme of archaeological work in accordance with a written scheme for investigation which has been submitted by the applicant and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  The archaeological works shall be carried out by a suitably qualified investigating body acceptable by the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To safeguard the special archaeological interest of the site (B28, B29 and 4.9).
